column5: Check .. check ... check ... the list is pretty much complete ... but what the heck ... and tonight we leave for the ZEC .. and all those fiesty Specks ... sheesh Im a poet ... and I think I even know it  Camera - check ... OFC logo for Team seven inches ... check ... whoooo hooooo ... its offff we go the ZEC !!!!!  Well in about 11 hrs and 1 minute .... but who's counting
Panther Martins... J-7 Rapala...  Ahh nevermind you're going to a ZEC, you should be able to catch em with cigarrette butts  Have a great trip! looking forward to the report when you get back.  Tony
dont forget your bugspray have a good trip

Funny you should mention that ... in fact I have NEVER been to a ZEC without at least 2 cartons of cigarettes ... this will be another lifetime first ... but after 74 days without a puff .... I am taking instead 8 packs of gum .... just in case .... a bottle of Porto, a bottle of scotch ..and just to be quite sure ... a bottle of vodka ......lots of wooly buggars, lots of mickey finns, some magog minnows .... but no butttttts
Batteries for the camera???... I'm soooo tired of those sooo lame "my batteries died" excuses.
Best of luck bud,bring along some sunflower seeds just for good measure Joe
Which ZEC are you going to?  I was thinking about a trip like that as well...Rapids Des Joachims was the one I was looking into...  Good luck..look forward to the pics!

St Gabriel De Brandon ... Mandeville .... ZEC des Nymphs .... sorry no GPS coords  In the South East corner of the Parc Tremblant (actuallly a few miles south East of it) .. anyhow ... I do have lots of Batteries .. so hopefully no excuses  And yes Joe ... I was just struggling with whether to buy a couple mega-pots of Jube - jubes in case the whole wilderness thing gets the better of me  Somehow though with the directors meeting out on the back bay at midnight .. I just dont see jube-jubes and 20 yr old port working

Milio, it's all up to you.  Just make it how you like.  Good luck, btw.  And, a ZEC is a Controlled Ecology Zone, like a provincial park in the rest of Canada.  Those French have a different word for everything.
